steps.title: Draw the outline sketch for the letters in pencil.
steps.content: Draw the outline sketch for the letters in pencil. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Add actual lines for the graffiti designs on the letters.
steps.content: Add actual lines for the graffiti designs on the letters. Most graffiti designs are connected, intersecting or on top of one part of the other. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Fill in the basic colors.
steps.content: Fill in the basic colors. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Add darker tone on the graffiti colors.
steps.content: Add darker tone on the graffiti colors.

steps.title: Add more details by drawing a design on the graffiti.
steps.content: Add more details by drawing a design on the graffiti. You can choose any design that you want. Metallic, balloon, fluffy, gummy, and so on. I chose drawing cracked lines on the sample.

steps.title: Add the cast shadow to complete the graffiti.
steps.content: Add the cast shadow to complete the graffiti.

steps.title: Draw the outline sketches for the letters.
steps.content: Draw the outline sketches for the letters.

steps.title: Add the actual lines for the graffiti designs on the letters.
steps.content: Add the actual lines for the graffiti designs on the letters. Draw pointed lines intersecting the others. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Add the highlights and shadows.
steps.content: Add the highlights and shadows. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Instead of adding shadows, choose a bright color that is contrasting the colors of the letters.
steps.content: Instead of adding shadows, choose a bright color that is contrasting the colors of the letters. Graffiti colors almost always have contrasting colors. However, you can also use colors that complement each other.

steps.title: Add more designs on the background to finish the graffiti.
steps.content: Add more designs on the background to finish the graffiti.
